comments.body: Wouldn't it be simpler to convert `allTestNames` to a set and test for equal length?

I tried that but the error message was useless. "expected _some giant list_ to have size 999 but was 972", or something. And an equality check resulted in "_some giant list_ does not equal _some other giant list_".

This yields an error message that you can actually use to find the problem.
Ah yes, makes sense. Not sure if it's worth collecting all the duplicate tests though before failing, as I wouldn't expect to get a lot of duplicates.
we already have a diffing lib in the legder API test tool, you could use that if you want but I’m also perfectly happy with this solution.

Rule number one of writing tests: make sure it fails.

Rule number two: make sure the failure tells you something useful.

GitHub didn't refresh comments and I didn't see the follow-ups until I checked my email. Apologies for making it look like I was ignoring you.

> [@nicu-da] Ah yes, makes sense. Not sure if it's worth collecting all the duplicate tests though before failing, as I wouldn't expect to get a lot of duplicates.
>
> ...
>
> [@cocreature] we already have a diffing lib in the legder API test tool, you could use that if you want but I’m also perfectly happy with this solution.

True, but I am lazy. Hopefully now this is fixed it should only have one failure at a time anyway. I'd like to leave it as it is for now.
